intro: Agrostemma, commonly known as the "corn poppy," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Eschscholzia. The plant features showy, red or orange flowers with a distinctive black center, and its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy. Agrostemma grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed areas. It is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
